chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
this: nid
W: world
A: Type
s: spec A
es: Pred_Class
e: DTbin this W s

Goal:
e \In es -> leq e (sup es)

Premises:
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> seq A -> Prop
leq = fun e1 e2 : DTbin s => e1 <== e2 : DTbin s -> DTbin s -> Prop
spec = fun A : Type => (pre * post A)%type : Type -> Type Arguments spec _%type_scope
Notation DTbin s := (SerTop.DTbin this W s)
sup = fun es : Pred (DTbin s) => DTbin_make (sup_spec (es:=es)) : Pred (DTbin s) -> DTbin s
leq_refl : forall e : DTbin s, leq e e
sup_set = fun (es : Pred (DTbin s)) (t : proc this W A) => t = Unfinished \/ (exists e : DTbin s, t \In e /\ e \In es) : Pred (DTbin s) -> proc this W A -> Prop
bot_bot : forall e : DTbin s, leq bot e
prog_unfin : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s : spec A) (e : SerTop.DTbin this W s), Unfinished \In e
leq_trans : forall e1 e2 e3 : DTbin s, leq e1 e2 -> leq e2 e3 -> leq e1 e3
sup_spec : forall es : Pred (DTbin s), sup_prog es \In has_spec this W s
leq_asym : forall e1 e2 : DTbin s, leq e1 e2 -> leq e2 e1 -> e1 = e2
DTbin_make : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s : spec A) (prog_of : SerTop.prog W A this), prog_of \In has_spec this W s -> SerTop.DTbin this W s
nary_congruence : forall n : nat, let k := fun (B : Type) (e : B -> B -> Prop) => forall y : B, e y y in nary_congruence_statement n k
Record DTbin (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s : spec A) : Type := DTbin_make { prog_of : SerTop.prog W A this; _ : prog_of \In has_spec this W s } Arguments DTbin.DTbin _ _ [A]%type_scope Arguments DTbin.DTbin_make [this W] [A]%type_scope [s prog_of]
with_spec : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s : spec A), SerTop.DTbin this W s -> DT this W A
DTbin.prog_of : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s : spec A), SerTop.DTbin this W s -> SerTop.prog W A this
spec_of : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type), DT this W A -> spec A
DT_ind : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (P : DT this W A -> Prop), (forall (s : spec A) (d : SerTop.DTbin this W s), P (with_spec d)) -> forall d : DT this W A, P d
DT_rec : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (P : DT this W A -> Set), (forall (s : spec A) (d : SerTop.DTbin this W s), P (with_spec d)) -> forall d : DT this W A, P d
DT_rect : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (P : DT this W A -> Type), (forall (s : spec A) (d : SerTop.DTbin this W s), P (with_spec d)) -> forall d : DT this W A, P d
DT_sind : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (P : DT this W A -> SProp), (forall (s : spec A) (d : SerTop.DTbin this W s), P (with_spec d)) -> forall d : DT this W A, P d
Inductive DT (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) : Type := with_spec : forall s : spec A, SerTop.DTbin this W s -> DT this W A Arguments DT _ _ _%type_scope Arguments with_spec [this W] [A]%type_scope [s]
sup_prog = fun es : Pred (DTbin s) => Prog (or_introl (erefl Unfinished)) : Pred (DTbin s) -> prog A
alw_unfin : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s1 : state) (P : state -> proc this W A -> Prop), s1 \In Coh W -> (forall s2 : state, network_rely W this s1 s2 -> P s2 Unfinished) -> always s1 Unfinished P
Seq : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A B : Type), proc this W B -> (B -> proc this W A) -> proc this W A
alw_ret : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s1 : state) (v : A) (P : state -> proc this W A -> Prop), s1 \In Coh W -> (forall s2 : state, network_rely W this s1 s2 -> P s2 (Ret v)) -> always s1 (Ret v) P
alw_unfin' : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s1 : state) (scs : seq schedule) (P : state -> proc this W A -> Prop), s1 \In Coh W -> (forall s2 : state, network_rely W this s1 s2 -> P s2 Unfinished) -> always_sc s1 Unfinished scs P
has_spec : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type), spec A -> Simpl_Pred (SerTop.prog W A this)
alw_ret' : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s1 : state) (v : A) (scs : seq schedule) (P : state -> proc this W A -> Prop), s1 \In Coh W -> (forall s2 : state, network_rely W this s1 s2 -> P s2 (Ret v)) -> always_sc s1 (Ret v) scs P
pstep : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type), state -> proc this W A -> schedule -> state -> proc this W A -> Prop
step : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type), state -> proc this W A -> schedule -> state -> proc this W A -> Prop
always : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type), state -> proc this W A -> (state -> proc this W A -> Prop) -> Prop
alw_act : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type) (s1 : state) (a : action W A this) (P : state -> proc this W A -> Prop), s1 \In Coh W -> (forall s2 : state, network_rely W this s1 s2 -> exists S : a_safe a s2, P s2 (Act a) /\ (forall (s3 : state) (v : A) (s4 : state), a_step S s3 v -> network_rely W this s3 s4 -> P s4 (Ret v))) -> always s1 (Act a) P
always_sc : forall (this : nid) (W : world) (A : Type), state -> proc this W A -> seq schedule -> (state -> proc this W A -> Prop) -> Prop
